com.navis.framework.persistence.hibernate

Class PersistenceUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.navis.framework.persistence.hibernate.PersistenceUtils

  • public class PersistenceUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Meant for framework transaction handling code, and diagnostic test code. Regular application engineers should not use this class.

    • Method Detail

      • isHibernateObject

        public static boolean isHibernateObject(java.lang.Object inObject)
        Checks an object to see if it refers to any Hibernating objects. This method will perform lightweight checks on collections, to see if the collection might contain Hibernate entities. This method does not traverse the entire object graph.
        Parameters:
        inObject - object to test
        Returns:
        true if this object contains Hibernate entities

      • handleRollback

        public static void handleRollback(java.lang.Throwable inException,
                                  org.hibernate.Transaction inTransaction,
                                  MessageCollector inCollector)
        Gracefully rollback the transaction and register any sql/jdbc errors that were thrown.

      • isDatabaseAlive

        public static boolean isDatabaseAlive(UserContext inUserContext)
        Call this method outside of a Hibernate session to test if the database is alive.
        Parameters:
        inUserContext -
        Returns:
        true if the database is still accessible.

      • createAndBindTransactionParmeters

        public static TransactionParms createAndBindTransactionParmeters(UserContext inContext,
                                                                 boolean inNullContextFailure)
        Create a new TransactionParms and Bind user context. TransactionSynchronizationManager will throw an error if already bound.

        caller must handle any runtim e

        Parameters:
        inContext -
        inNullContextFailure - send in true if you want to throw a failure if inContext is null
        Returns:
        newly created TransactionParms
